title:
Distinguishing nodal and nonunitary superconductivity in quasiparticle
  interference of an Ising superconductor with Rashba spin-orbit coupling: an
  example of NbSe$_2$
authors: Jozef Hani\v{s}, Marko Milivojevi\'c, Martin Gmitra
abstract:
The NbSe$_2$ monolayer with Rashba spin-orbit coupling represents a
paradigmatic example of an Ising superconductor on a substrate. Using a
single-band model and symmetry analysis, we present general superconducting
pairing functions beyond the nearest-neighbor approximation, uncovering new
types of gap functions, including the nodal singlet gap function and the
triplet non-unitary pairing function that breaks time-reversal symmetry. The
non-unitarity builts in the asymmetrical band dispersion in the superconducting
quasiparticle energy spectra. Performing exact T-matrix calculations of
quasiparticle interference due to a single scalar impurity scattering, we found
that the interference patterns possess characteristic features distinguishing
the type of pairing and possible nematic and chiral symmetry violations.
